Use the up and down arrows to move items along the tree, del to delete an item and F2 to rename it.
You can edit commands in the command window.

entry.name: LoadFail
entry.text: An error occurred while loading the button. This might be due to an erroneous XML file. Check the log file for details on the erro.

entry.name: Intstructions
entry.text:
Button Customization Instructions
You can assign a different action to each mouse button. Here's a list of actions you can configure:
- None: the button will do nothing.
- Single Command: the button will send a simple command to UO.
- Menu: the button will bring up a menu that will allow you to select a command to send to UO.
- Last Command: this will send to UO whatever command has been last sent. This is useful with complex menus and requires a menu to be defined on the other button before it can be added.
- Multi Command: This is a special command/menu combo and takes both mouse slots. When right clicked the button will display a list of commands: you can choose one of those commands to be the default command. Left clicking the button will send to UO the default command. This type of function will ignore the button caption as it will be changed according to the default command selected.
- Modifier Command: This behaviour allows you to specify one command which will be used when left clicking the button. When right clicking the button, the modifiers menu will popup allowing you to send the command using the selected modifier.
Once you have assigned a function to a button, you can edit it by right clicking the corresponding link in order to modify the existing function rather than create a new one.

entry.name: Instructions
entry.text:
Add new items using the area above. You can display and edit the contents of an item by right clicking it in the listing.
You can press the Delete button on the list view to remove an entry.
You can use the up and down arrow keys to move the entries in the list.

If you wish to add locations to a different map, please do so by selecting the appropriate branch on the travel tree.

entry.name: NoMaps

entry.name: TravelFormat
entry.text:
You can define the format used on the send and go commands by using the following terms instead of the respective values:
{x}, {y}, {z} for the three x,y,z coordinates {map} for the map name
Pandora's Box provides you with a custom script that creates a custom GoMap command. The format for this custom command is:
GoMap {x} {y} {z} {map}
and it will teleport you to the correct map plane. If you decide to stick with the default commands, you can check the SetMy Map checkbox in order to set your map before going to your destination. Please note that you will have to manually set the map when sending a player.

entry.name: RequestConnection
entry.text: The action you're trying to perform requires a connection to the BoxServer. Would you like to connect now?

entry.name: PassSecurity
entry.text:
In order to access the BoxServer features you must provide Pandora's Box with your game staff account username and password. This is sensitive information and will be treated by Pandora's Box appropriately.
Your account name will be stored as is in the profiles xml file. The password however will be encoded using a hashing algorithm that is not reversible. This means that the algorithm does loose data in the encoding process, therefore making it extremely hard to retrieve the original password from the encoded result. Pandora's box will only store the encoded password. You can see the result of the encoding in the profile.xml file.
Your real password is never stored on file by Pandora's Box. It stays in memory only when you enter it for the first time, until you confirm it. Then only the encoded password is stored and exchanged with the BoxServer, which applies the same algorithm on the password stored on the RunUO server to perform authentication.

entry.name: Range2ToolTip
entry.text:
This is an additional field that can be used in the spawner constructor. It is not used in the default version, but you can use it to add a further property to a custom spawner. For example, when using David's spawner you can use this parameter to represent the SpawnRange property.
You can enable this parameter in the Commands Options using the {extra} parameter in the Spawn command.

entry.name: Operators
entry.text:
Available operators:
- == : the objects property matches the value - != : the objects property does not match the value - > : the objects property is greater than the value - < : the objects property is less than the value - >= : the objects property is greater than or equal to the value - <= : the objects property is less than or equal to the value
String only operators:
- ==~ : the object property is equal to the value, case insensitive - starts : the object property starts with the value, case sensitive - starts~ : the object property starts with the value, case insensitive - ends : the object property ends with the, case sensitive - ends~ : the object property ends with the value, case insensitive - contains : the object property contains the value, case sensitive - contains~ : the object property contains the value, case insensitive

entry.name: Spawn
entry.text:
Available properties are:
{creature} - The name of the creature as selected in the NPCs tab. {amount}, {min}, {max}, {team}, {range} correspond to the values in the Spawn configuration. {extra} is an additional parameter that can be used in conjunction with a custom spawner.

{map} : The value corresponding to the target map.

entry.name: Go

{x}, {y}, {z} : The x, y and z coordinates of the target location {map} : A value corresponding to the map plane the target location is on

entry.text: The new location couldn't be added because the node selected on the category tree was not correct. Please report this bug to the author.

An unexpected error has occurred. Details have been recorded in the log file.
Please contact the author with your log file if you wish to support development.

entry.name: SetMsg
entry.text:
Please click the light you wish to set by default on all the items added through the Deco section.
Note: not all items support light sources.

entry.name: ToolTip
entry.text: Check the checkbox to select a profile as default.

entry.name: Instructions
entry.text:
Before creating a selection, make sure you create a new entry using the New button, and select it in the combo box in the top left area of the window.
Selecting hues:
- Left click and drag to select hues. - Ctrl + click a hue to deselect it if selected. - Click a hue, then shift + click another hue to select the whole range of hues between them.
Once you're happy with your selection make sure you hit the Update button to save your selection to the current template.

entry.name: DeleteGroup
entry.text: Are you sure you wish to delete this group?

entry.name: NoData
entry.text: The data you requested is not available on the server. Contact your shard administrator to generate it.

entry.name: ConnectionLost
entry.text:
There has been an error when communicating with the server.
This can be due to a connection loss, or to an error in the remote script. You can find more details about the error in the BoxLog.txt file in your Pandora's Box folder.

entry.name: NoServer
entry.text: The feature you're trying to use requires a connection to a Box Server. Please configure the server in the program options to access it.

entry.name: GenServErr
entry.text:
The BoxServer encountered an error when processing your request. The server said:
{0}

entry.name: NotOnline
entry.text: Authentication failed: you must be logged in into the server in order to access this feature.

entry.name: Generic
entry.text: The server has returned an unkown error.

entry.name: DelProfileErr
entry.text: Unable to delete selected profile. Details about the error occurred have been recorded in the log file.

entry.name: ServerError
entry.text: A BoxServer is installed on the remote system. However the installation seems to be incomplete, missing a required file (BoxServer.cs). Please contact your shard administrator to fix this problem.

entry.name: CantDelButton
entry.text: There was an error when processing the request: can't delete file {0}.

entry.name: ServerConnection
entry.text: The connection to the server failed. Make sure a firewall isn't blocking you and ensure that the server is up and properly configured to offer BoxServer connections.

entry.name: WrongFile
entry.text:
The selected file is either corrupted or doesn't contain valid data for this process.
Action aborted.

entry.text: Authentication failed: your Access Level isn't high enough to use this feature;

entry.name: LogUnregistered

entry.name: Spawn

entry.name: AccessLevel
entry.text: Your access level isn't high enough to access Pandora's Box server extensions.

entry.name: NotSupported

entry.name: WrongCredentials

The modifier you are about to use requires an additional confirmation. Are you sure you wish to use the following:

entry.name: NoImage
entry.text: An error occurred when displaying a pre generated map image. You can find details in the program log. You can attempt correcting this error by running the Image Generation process from the Configuration Panel.

entry.name: GlobalWarning
entry.text:
You are about to use a command on all existing items and mobiles, including players not logged in.
Are you sure you wish to proceed?

entry.name: OnlineWarning
entry.text:
You are about to execute a command on all the players currently logged in.
Are you sure you wish to proceed?

entry.name: SpecifyServer
entry.text: Please specify a valid location for the server executable.

entry.name: NoServerFile
entry.text: The server executable specified isn't valid. Please change it and try again.

entry.name: BrushDesc
entry.text: This feature is similat to the random area tiler, but uses a smaller brush (maximum size 15x15) to fill areas providing the user with a target in game.

entry.name: NoMap
entry.text: In order to use this feature you must specify a map on which the tiling will occur. This is used by Pandora's Box to calculate the height for each tile and is a mandatory parameter.

entry.name: Drag
entry.text: Drag'n'drop an item from the deco section to quickly add it to the template.

entry.name: AddItems
entry.text: Add a single item ID for each line, or drag'n'drop an item from the deco section to add it.

entry.name: SingleDesc
entry.text: This feature uses BoxServer to add several random items one after the other. When executed, this feature will present you with a target in game. Using the target multiple times will allow you to add items randomly choosen from the tileset on the left, and hued according to your choice.

entry.name: AreaDesc
entry.text: This features randomdly tiles items on an area specified by a rectangle. The fill slider specifies the percentage of the area that will be filled.

entry.name: Purge
entry.text: {0} templates have been removed from the list because they were empty.

entry.name: NoRndHue
entry.text: You have chosen to use random huing but haven't specified a random hue template for this action. Please define a random hue group first.

entry.name: InvalidIDs
entry.text: No valid item IDs have been specified.
